definitions: counter or area in a store where customers pay for goods before leaving
process of completing payment and leaving a hotel or hospital after a stay
examples: The checkout line was long during the holiday shopping season
She waited at the checkout with her groceries and coupons
Hotel checkout is at noon on Sunday morning
The hospital checkout process took several hours to complete

definitions: designated place where travelers or vehicles are stopped for inspection or control
examples: The military checkpoint stopped all vehicles entering the city
Security officers searched bags at the airport checkpoint thoroughly

definitions: firm yellow or orange cheese originally made in Cheddar, England
examples: She added sharp cheddar to her sandwich for extra flavor
The recipe calls for two cups of grated cheddar cheese

definitions: prominent bone below the eye that forms the upper part of the cheek
examples: Her high cheekbones gave her face an elegant appearance
The makeup artist applied highlighter to emphasize her cheekbones

definitions: act of shouting encouragement or approval, especially at sports events or performances
examples: The loud cheering from the crowd motivated the home team
Their enthusiastic cheering could be heard throughout the stadium

definitions: person who leads organized cheering at sports events, typically wearing a uniform
someone who enthusiastically promotes or supports a person, cause, or organization
examples: The cheerleaders performed complex routines during halftime at the game
She was voted captain of the high school cheerleader squad
He became the company's biggest cheerleader for the new product launch
The mayor acted as cheerleader for the city's development project

definitions: sandwich consisting of a cooked beef patty topped with cheese in a bun
examples: He ordered a double cheeseburger with fries and a milkshake
The restaurant is famous for its bacon cheeseburgers with special sauce

definitions: rich dessert made with cream cheese, eggs, and sugar on a crust base
examples: She baked a strawberry cheesecake for her daughter's birthday party
The New York style cheesecake was dense and incredibly creamy

definitions: large African cat with spotted coat known as the fastest land animal
examples: The cheetah can reach speeds of seventy miles per hour
Wildlife photographers captured the cheetah hunting on the savanna

definitions: scientist who studies or works with chemicals and their properties and reactions
person who prepares and sells medicines in a pharmacy, especially in British English
examples: The chemist discovered a new compound in her laboratory research
Industrial chemists develop new materials for manufacturing processes
Ask the chemist about the proper dosage for this medication
The local chemist stays open late on weekday evenings

definitions: medical treatment using powerful chemical drugs to destroy cancer cells in the body
examples: The patient underwent six months of chemotherapy for breast cancer
Side effects from chemotherapy can include hair loss and fatigue

definitions: written order directing a bank to pay money from an account to a specified person
examples: She wrote a cheque for the monthly rent payment yesterday
The company sent refund cheques to all affected customers promptly

definitions: small round red or black fruit with a stone inside and sweet flesh
tree that produces cherry fruit, often grown for its blossoms and wood
examples: She topped the sundae with a bright red maraschino cherry
Fresh cherries are perfect for making pies during summer season
The cherry trees bloom beautifully in spring throughout the park
They planted a cherry tree in their backyard last autumn

definitions: representation of a baby angel with wings in art and religious imagery
examples: The cathedral ceiling was decorated with painted cherubs and clouds
Stone cherubs adorned the fountain in the Italian garden courtyard

definitions: square board with sixty-four alternating dark and light squares for playing chess
examples: He carefully arranged the pieces on the wooden chessboard before playing
The marble chessboard was a beautiful centerpiece in the library

definitions: any of the pieces used in playing chess, including pawns, knights, bishops, rooks, queens, and kings
examples: She moved her chessman forward to capture the opponent's bishop
The antique chessmen were carved from ivory and ebony wood

definitions: glossy brown edible nut that grows in a spiky case on trees
reddish-brown color resembling the color of a chestnut
examples: Roasted chestnuts are a popular winter treat in many cities
She gathered chestnuts from under the tree in the park
Her horse had a beautiful chestnut coat that gleamed in sunlight
He chose a chestnut leather jacket to match his boots

definitions: V-shaped line or stripe used as a decorative pattern or design element
V-shaped badge worn on military or police uniforms to indicate rank
examples: The sweater featured a bold chevron pattern in blue and white
Chevron tiles created an interesting visual effect on the floor
The sergeant wore three chevrons on his uniform sleeve proudly
Each chevron represents years of service in the police force

definitions: action of crushing or grinding food with teeth before swallowing
examples: Proper chewing helps with digestion and nutrient absorption in bodies
The sound of chewing gum annoyed everyone in the quiet library

definitions: twenty-second letter of the Greek alphabet, written as X in uppercase
vital life force or energy in Chinese philosophy and traditional medicine
examples: The chi symbol is often used in mathematics and science
Students learned to write chi correctly in their Greek class
Tai chi movements help balance the body's chi energy flow
Acupuncture aims to restore the proper flow of chi

definitions: elegantly and stylishly fashionable quality in dress, manner, or design
examples: Her apartment had a modern chic that impressed all visitors
The boutique specializes in chic clothing for professional women

definitions: young bird, especially a newly hatched domestic fowl
informal term for a young woman, sometimes considered offensive
examples: The yellow chicks followed their mother hen around the farmyard
Baby chicks need warmth and protection for several weeks
The movie portrayed 1960s chicks in miniskirts and go-go boots
Some people find the term chick offensive when referring to women

definitions: highly contagious viral disease causing itchy blisters, mainly affecting children
examples: Most children recover from chickenpox within two weeks without complications
The chickenpox vaccine has greatly reduced cases in many countries

definitions: round beige legume used in cooking, also known as garbanzo bean
examples: Chickpeas are the main ingredient in traditional hummus recipes worldwide
She added roasted chickpeas to her salad for extra protein

definitions: plant with bitter leaves used in salads and as a vegetable
plant root that is roasted and ground as a coffee substitute or additive
examples: The salad contained chicory, arugula, and other bitter greens mixed together
Belgian endive is actually a type of chicory grown differently
New Orleans coffee often includes chicory for its distinctive flavor
During wartime, people used chicory root as a coffee substitute

definitions: leader of a clan, tribe, or group, especially in traditional societies
examples: The Highland chieftain led his clan members into battle bravely
Village elders elected a new chieftain after the ceremony ended

definitions: lightweight, sheer fabric made from silk, cotton, or synthetic fibers
examples: Her wedding dress featured layers of delicate white chiffon fabric
The chiffon scarf floated gracefully in the summer breeze outside

definitions: process of being pregnant and giving birth to children
examples: Women of childbearing age should take folic acid supplements daily
The clinic provides healthcare services throughout the childbearing years

definitions: process of giving birth to a baby, including labor and delivery
examples: She attended classes to prepare for natural childbirth without medication
Modern medicine has made childbirth much safer than in past centuries

definitions: care and supervision of children, especially by people other than parents
examples: Finding affordable childcare is challenging for many working parents today
The company provides on-site childcare facilities for employee families

definitions: long narrow country on the western coast of South America
examples: Chile stretches over 2,600 miles along the Pacific Ocean coastline
The Andes Mountains form Chile's eastern border with neighboring Argentina

definitions: hot pepper used fresh or dried to add spice to food
spicy stew containing meat, beans, tomatoes, and chili peppers
examples: She added fresh green chili to the salsa for heat
The dried chili peppers gave the sauce its distinctive flavor
The restaurant serves the best chili with cornbread in town
He won the annual chili cook-off with his secret recipe

definitions: unpleasant feeling of coldness in the atmosphere or one's body
feeling of fear or anxiety that makes one shiver
examples: There was a chill in the autumn air this morning
She felt a sudden chill and pulled her sweater tighter
A chill ran down his spine when he heard footsteps
The ghost story gave everyone chills around the campfire

definitions: machine or container for keeping things cold, especially in industrial settings
book, movie, or story designed to cause fear or suspense
examples: The industrial chiller keeps the factory equipment from overheating constantly
Wine chillers maintain bottles at the perfect serving temperature
She couldn't put down the psychological chiller she was reading
The movie was marketed as a supernatural chiller for Halloween

definitions: small hot-tasting pod used fresh or dried as a spice
examples: Thai cuisine often uses bird's eye chilli for intense heat
She grew different varieties of chilli in her garden greenhouse

definitions: causing fear or horror in a disturbing or unsettling way
process of making or becoming cold, especially for preservation
examples: The chilling details of the crime shocked the entire community
His chilling scream echoed through the empty house at night
Chilling the dough helps cookies maintain their shape while baking
The chilling process is essential for proper chocolate tempering

definitions: melodious ringing sound made by a bell or similar instrument
set of hanging tubes or bells that make musical sounds when moved
examples: The clock tower chime marked every hour throughout the day
She loved the gentle chime of the doorbell at grandmother's house
Wind chimes created a peaceful atmosphere on the porch outside
The bronze chimes rang softly in the evening breeze

definitions: mythological creature with parts from multiple animals, typically lion, goat, and serpent
thing that is hoped for but is illusory or impossible to achieve
examples: Ancient Greek vases often depicted the chimera breathing fire fearlessly
The chimera sculpture combined a lion's head with goat body
His plan for instant wealth was nothing but a chimera
The perfect society remains a chimera despite our best efforts

definitions: vertical structure that carries smoke and gases from a fire out through a roof
examples: Santa Claus traditionally enters homes through the chimney on Christmas Eve
The old brick chimney needed repairs before winter arrived

definitions: informal shortened form of chimpanzee, an intelligent African ape
examples: The chimp used a stick to extract termites from the mound
Researchers studied how chimps communicate with each other in groups

definitions: great ape native to African forests, closely related to humans genetically
examples: The chimpanzee demonstrated remarkable problem-solving abilities in the study
Wild chimpanzees live in complex social groups with distinct hierarchies

definitions: high-quality porcelain or ceramic dishes, cups, and plates for dining
country in East Asia, officially the People's Republic of China
examples: Grandmother's antique china was only used for special holiday dinners
The wedding china pattern featured delicate gold trim and roses
China has the world's largest population of any single country
Ancient China contributed many important inventions to world civilization

definitions: small South American rodent with very soft, dense gray fur
examples: The chinchilla takes dust baths to keep its fur clean naturally
Chinchilla fur coats were once highly prized luxury items worldwide

definitions: durable cotton twill fabric used for uniforms and casual clothing
casual pants made from chino cloth, typically in khaki or similar colors
examples: The military first used chino fabric for uniforms in hot climates
Chino cloth is known for its durability and comfortable wear
He wore chinos with a button-down shirt to the office
These chinos come in several colors besides traditional khaki

definitions: small North American rodent with distinctive stripes on its back and pouched cheeks
examples: The chipmunk stuffed its cheeks with acorns for winter storage
Children enjoyed watching chipmunks scamper around the park benches

definitions: smoke-dried jalapeño pepper used in Mexican cuisine for smoky, spicy flavor
examples: The sauce gets its distinctive taste from chipotle peppers in adobo
She added chipotle powder to the marinade for extra smokiness

definitions: small fragment that has broken away from something larger
short golf shot played near the green to get the ball airborne briefly
examples: Paint chipping from the old house revealed multiple color layers
The chipping on the antique vase reduced its market value
His chipping around the green improved his golf scores significantly
Practice your chipping technique at the driving range regularly

definitions: system of complementary medicine focusing on diagnosis and treatment of mechanical disorders of the musculoskeletal system, especially the spine
examples: Chiropractic treatment helped relieve her chronic back pain without surgery
The chiropractic clinic specializes in sports injuries and workplace ergonomics
